title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

Responses may use alternative notations for dy dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CD7@ such as y ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWG5bGbauaaaaa@3A04@ .

The first point is earned if there is at most one sign error for the derivative of the term −x​y MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaWG4bGaaGzaVlaadMhaaaa@3D6C@ and the remainder of the equation is correct.

The first point is earned with a completely correct derivative of x 2 −x​y+2 y 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@433F@ .

The second point cannot be earned if there are any errors.

It is sufficient to present ( 4y−x ) dy dx =y−2x MathType@MTEF@5@5@@470E@ to earn the second point, provided that there are no subsequent errors. It is not necessary to simplify to dy dx = y−2x 4y−x MathType@MTEF@5@5@@45D3@ .
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The second point is earned by substituting x=4y MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CD9@ or y= 1 4 x MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D84@ into the equation of the curve.

y−2x≠0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F1F@ is not required to earn the first point, but it is required to earn the third point.

A response that imports an incorrect expression for dy dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D35@ from part (a) can earn the first and second points only if the expression for dy dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D35@ is a quotient of two linear polynomials in x and y with both variables appearing in the numerator and denominator. Such a response cannot earn the third point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point is earned for a correct application of the quotient rule (or product rule), with or without the chain rule.

The second point is earned if the derivatives of all of the y terms are correct (i.e., dy dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D35@ and 4 dy dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DF3@ ) AND the presented d 2 y d x 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F4F@ satisfies exactly one of the following:

· d 2 y d x 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F4F@ is completely correct.

· The quotient rule was used and

o there are sign errors in front of either or both of the two terms in the numerator of d 2 y d x 2 , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4009@ and there are no other errors.

o the numerator of d 2 y d x 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F4F@ is correct but the denominator is not squared, and there are no other errors.

o the numerator of d 2 y d x 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F4F@ has missing parentheses around the factors in one or both terms, and there are no other errors.

· The product rule was used and there is a sign error between the two terms, and there are no other errors.

· The derivative of one of either −2x MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaaIYaGaamiEaaaa@3BA0@ or −x MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaWG4baaaa@3AE4@ is incorrect, and there are no other errors.

To earn the third point, a response must have earned at least 1 of the first 2 points, presented a value of d 2 y d x 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F4F@ at ( 1,  2 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4070@ and have a conclusion consistent with this presented value.

To earn the fourth point, a response must have earned the first 3 points and must present a d 2 y d x 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F4E@ equivalent to − 2 7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BD1@ with no computational errors.

A response that imports an incorrect expression for dy dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D35@ from part (a) can earn the first and second points only if the expression for dy dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D35@ is a quotient of two linear polynomials in x and y with both variables appearing in the numerator and denominator. Such a response cannot earn the third or fourth points.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes three of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all four of the criteria below.
